headline: Stocks to Watch for a Rebound Amid September Rate Cut Hopes
summary: Amid high hopes for a September rate cut, these stocks may be poised for a sharp rebound from various sectors where companies are sensitive to borrowing costs, capital market activity, and consumer demand.

raw.headline: Stocks to Watch for a Rebound Amid September Rate Cut Hopes
raw.summary: Amid high hopes for a September rate cut, these stocks may be poised for a sharp rebound from various sectors where companies are sensitive to borrowing costs, capital market activity, and consumer demand.

headline: Trump again pushes US agency to revoke NBC, ABC station licenses
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -President Donald Trump reiterated a long-running push for the Federal Communications Commission to revoke station licenses of two major U.S. broadcasters and charge them for using the public airwaves, as he criticized their news programming.  The FCC, an independent federal agency, issues eight-year licenses to individual broadcast stations, not networks.  Trump also suggested broadcasters should be required to pay millions of dollars in license fees for the broadcast spectrum they use.

headline: Figma, Netflix, Disney, Comcast: Trending Tickers

headline: Stocks to Watch Monday: Keurig Dr Pepper, JDE Peet’s, PDD, Orsted
summary: ↗️ Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP); JDE Peet’s (NL:JPED): Keurig Dr Pepper agreed to buy the owner of Peet’s Coffee for $18 billion, a prelude to spinning off its coffee brands. Shares in JDE Peet's surged 17%.

headline: Trump Threatens NBC, ABC Licenses Over News Coverage
summary: The networks “give me 97% BAD STORIES,” Trump said in a Truth Social post on Sunday, “despite a very high popularity and, according to many, among the greatest 8 months in Presidential History.”  “IF THAT IS THE CASE, THEY ARE SIMPLY AN ARM OF THE DEMOCRAT PARTY AND SHOULD, ACCORDING TO MANY, HAVE THEIR LICENSES REVOKED BY THE FCC,” he added.  The FCC issues licenses to owners of television stations, which must be periodically renewed.
